text: Acleris ulmicola is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in South Korea, China, Japan, Taiwan and Russia (Amur Oblast). The wingspan is 13–16 mm. There are two seasonal forms. The summer generation is white, while the autumn generation is grey.Transactions of the Lepidopterological Society of Japan 14(4), 80–89, 1964-05-30 The larvae feed on Ulmus davidiana and Ulmus propinqua.Check List of the Tribe Tortricini (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae) in Northeast china, with Two Newly Recorded Species from China ==References== Category:Moths described in 1930 ulmicola Category:Moths of Asia
title: Acleris ulmicola
